intro: Calendula glabrata, commonly known as the smooth marigold, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in late summer and early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calendula glabrata is often used in herbal medicine for its anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
